VALUER Type: VALUERSDescription: Highways and Transport

description: Erection of single storey rear extension to provide covered seating area. Installation of kitchen extraction system. (Retrospective)
subdivision_of_building: Rear yard space, used as seating area for customers of caf? trading from the ground floor of the two-storey premises at 48 Surbiton Road
decision_conditions: The development hereby permitted shall begin before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.Reason: This is required by Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

There shall be no playing of amplified music within the seating area hereby approved outside of the following hours 0900-1800 Monday to Saturday and not at all on Sundays. Reason: To ensure satisfactory living conditions for neighbouring occupiers, in accordance with policy D3 of the London Plan 2021 and policy DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

The seating area hereby approved shall be free of patrons or members of staff outside of the following hours 0630-1800 Monday to Saturday and shall not be used at all by staff or patrons on a Sunday. Reason: To ensure satisfactory living conditions for neighbouring occupiers, in accordance with policy D3 of the London Plan 2021 and policy DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

The windows serving the outdoor seating area hereby approved shall only open inwards i.e. they shall not open outwards over the public highway / footpath.Reason: So as not to present a hazard to those pedestrians using the public footpath / highway.

Within 2 months of consent being granted written details shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority demonstrating that an acoustic attenuator of the same specification as stated in the submitted Noise Impact Assessment by Nova Acoustics dated 22nd June 2022 has been installed on the atmospheric side of the extract fan within the kitchen extraction system. Once agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority  the approved details shall be retained thereafter.If the details are not approved within 6 months of the permission hereby granted the use of the outside seating area shall cease until such time as the details are approved and implemented. Reason: To ensure satisfactory living conditions for neighbouring occupiers, in accordance with policy D3 of the London Plan 2021 and policy DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

Within 2 months from the date of this permission a Fire Safety Strategy shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. The Fire Safety Strategy shall demonstrate how the development will achieve the highest standards of fire safety and shall include the following details:1) suitably positioned outside space for fire appliances/ an evacuation assembly point; 2) Appropriate fire alarm systems; 3) Passive and active fire safety measures; 4) appropriate construction details to minimise the risk of fire spread; 5) provision of suitable and convenient means of escape/ an evacuation strategy; 6) provision of suitable access and equipment for firefighting which is appropriate for the size and use of the development. The Fire Safety Strategy shall include a statement of competence. The development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved Strategy and thereafter maintained. If the details are not approved within 6 months of the permission hereby granted the use of the outside seating area shall cease until such time as the details are approved and implemented. The required Fire Safety Strategy shall reference the London Plan Guidance Fire Safety (February 2022), where applicable and a Reasonable Exception Statement (RES) shall be submitted in relation to those fire safety requirements which the applicant does not consider to be relevant. Reason: In the interests of fire safety and to ensure the safety of all building users in accordance with Policy D12 (Fire Safety) of the London Plan 2021.

Within 2 months of consent being granted written details shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority demonstrating that a vertical discharge terminal duct at the top of the extraction duct capable of achieving an air flow of 15m/sec has been installed. Once agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority the approved details shall be retained thereafter.Informative: A cowl capable of increasing the terminal velocity of exhaust gases, known as a Jet Cowl may be required.If the details are not approved within 6 months of the permission hereby granted the use of the outside seating area shall cease until such time as the details are approved and implemented. Reason: To ensure satisfactory living conditions for neighbouring occupiers, in accordance with policy D3 of the London Plan 2021 and policy DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

Within 2 months of consent being granted written details shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority demonstrating that works to the odour abatement of the extraction system has been installed to the low/medium control as specified in the Control of Odour and Noise from Commercial Kitchen Exhaust Systems" published by EMAQ+ dated September 2018. Once agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority Once agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority the approved details shall be retained thereafter.If the details are not approved within 6 months of the permission hereby granted the use of the outside seating area shall cease until such time as the details are approved and implemented. Reason: To ensure satisfactory living conditions for neighbouring occupiers, in accordance with policy D3 of the London Plan 2021 and policy DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

Within 2 months of the date of this permission details of waste and recycling facilities to serve the development to which this permission relates shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. The refuse and recycling facilities as shown in the approved details shall be provided within 1 month of the written approval of the local planning authority and shall be permanently retained thereafter. The developer and/or their successors in title shall take all reasonable steps to ensure that all refuse and recyclable materials associated with the development are either stored within these facilities or internally within the building(s) on the application site, and that no refuse or recycling material is stored or placed for collection on the public highway except on the day of collection.If the details are not approved within 6 months of the permission hereby granted the use of the outside seating area shall cease until such time as the details are approved and implemented. Informative - Refuse and Recycling shall not be stored between the staircase and the side access.Reason: To ensure proper waste management in the interests of the character and appearance of the area, the living conditions of neighbouring occupiers, and in the interests of fire safety  in accordance with policy SI17 of the London Plan 2021 and policies CS8 and DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.
